docs.lead_paragraph: A GENERATION ago, fat babies were considered healthy and buxom actresses were popular, but society has since come to worship thinness, with serious psychological implications for people who are overweight. Victims of appetite disorders, mostly young people, are starving themselves to death, eating themselves into obesity and alternately gorging themselves and forcing themselves to vomit to try to maintain their weight. The International Journal of Eating Disorders estimates that as many as 4.5 percent of the women in this country and one-half of 1 percent of the men have appetite disorders. Another study done at the University of Minnesota suggested that 57 percent of college women and 41 percent of the college men have had an experience with serious eating disorders.
